","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl15_divTabs_1","title":"Emergency Preparedness Plan","content":"

MTPS Emergency Preparedness Plan - March 23 Update","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl15_divTabs_2","title":"Student Attendance","content":"
Daily Attendance is taken by posting an attendance note in the Genesis Parent Portal.  



Attendance can be posted at any time during the current day. Students will be marked absent if their attendance is not posted for the day.   



If you forgot to post attendance for a prior day, please contact genesishelp@mtps.com

 

Attendance Procedure:

High School and Middle School students should log into their genesis account and post their own attendance for the day.

For preK – 6th Grade students, parents/guardians should log into their parent genesis account to post their student’s attendance.



How to post attendance Notes in Genesis 

After you submit your attendance note, it shows up with a red ‘X’.  When the note is processed  by the school’s attendance office, it will change to a green  check mark.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl15_divTabs_3","title":"IT Resouces","content":"
Technical Support Contact Information


Student and parents may contact the MTPS tech team if experiencing a technical problem at home with the MTPS computer or with the online systems that MTPS supports. If you get a busy signal or voicemail, we recommend calling back later or using the email address if possible. Email can be sent to these addresses anytime, and a tech team member will respond as soon as they can.





    
        

             School
             Email
             Telephone (M-F 8-12, 12:30-2)
        
        

             Baker
             bakersupport@mtps.com
             856-778-6630 x 15250

            
        
        

             Roberts
             robertssupport@mtps.com
             856-778-6635 x 16250
        
        

             South Valley
             svsupport@mtps.com
             856-778-6640 x 17250
        
        

             UES
             uessupport@mtps.com
             856-793-0333 x 14250
        
        

             WAMS

             856-778-6620 x 13250
        
        

             MHS
             mhssupport@mtps.com
             856-778-6610 x 12250
        
        

             District
             laptopsupport@mtps.com
             N/A

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl15_divTabs_4","title":"Lunch Distribution","content":"

Lunch Distribution and Requests

During the school closure, Nutri-Serve can pack your lunch to-go for student who qualify for free and reduced lunches. 



Lunch deliveries for orders placed are on Mondays.  Nutri-Serve will prepare five days worth of non-perishable lunches for qualifying students who fill out the order form in Genesis. 



The Lunch Request Forms for each week are now in Genesis.   You must log into the Primary Guardian Account to access the form.



Genesis Link to Lunch Request Form

Instructions how to submit the Lunch Request in Genesis







Free and Reduced Lunch Application

If your income has changed due to COVID-19 and you believe you may qualify for Free or Reduced lunch, please open the below link and follow the directions for completing the application.



Free and Reduced Lunch Application







Food Bank Resources

Burlington County Food Pantry Resource

Food Bank of South Jersey


","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl15_divTabs_5","title":"Counseling and Social Emotional Learning","content":"

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl15_divTabs_8","title":"Additional Resources for At Home Learning","content":"
From the Department of Education:

    
Department of Defense: Learn about careers in STEM fields
    
Department of Education National Center for Education Statistics: Kids' Zone
    
Department of Energy: Games and Activities; Virtual Field Trips to National Energy Labs
    
Environmental Protection Agency: Games, Quizzes, and Videos about the Environment
    
The Library of Congress: Presentations and Activities to Help Students Learn about History
    
NASA: Interactive Lessons about Space, Earth, Solar System and Universe;  Lessons from Astronauts about Living in Space;  STEM Activities for Students of All Ages
    
The Kennedy Center:  Lunch Doodles with Mo Willems; Tour the Kennedy Center with The Pigeon


    
The Smithsonian: Free Smithsonian STEM Games and Simulations; Meet the Animals of the National Zoo; 3D Exhibits and Virtual Tours; Smithsonian Magazine Ten Museums You Can Virtually Visit; The Museum of Natural History Virtual Tour; Digital Smithsonian American Art Museum; Distance Learning Resources
    
NOAA: Use Real-Time Ocean Data to Explore the Environment


    
USGS: Learn from Home About Physical science, Geography and Maps






Virtual Tours from MTPS Curriculum Corner



    
Hawai'i Volcanoes National Park
    
The Louvre
    
Great Wall of China
    
National Marine Sanctuaries Virtual Dives
    
Khan Academy Imagineering in a Box
    
Ride a Virtual Roller Coaster: The Coaster Views on YouTube; The Sharp Productions on YouTube
    
Get Crafty: Trend Enterprises; Family Fun Crafts
    
Visit an Aquarium: Georgia Aquarium's Ocean Voyager webcam; JellyCam at Monterey Bay Aquarium; Tennessee Aquarium''s Penguins Rock Cam; the National Aquarium
    
Visit a Zoo: Panda Cam at Zoo Atlanta; two different Panda Cams at the National Zoo in Washington DC; Panda Cam at the San Diego Zoo; Giraffe Cam at the Houston Zoo; San Diego Zoo, Cincinnati Zoo's daily live stream; The Smithsonian National Zoo, the Minnesota Zoo
    
Go to Space:  Access Mars; NASA TV; NASA At Home; 3D Virtual Tour of the International Space Station on YouTube; Hubble Space Telescope 360 Degree Virtual Tour

    

    
","active":false,"disabled":false}],// required,
                        propPaneId: 'paneId', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propTitle: 'title', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propActive: 'active', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propDisabled: 'disabled', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propContent: 'content', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        tabMode : tabM,
                        scrollToTabEdge: false, // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        disableScrollArrowsOnFullyScrolled: false // optional- pass in default value for demo purposes
                    }).on('ready.scrtabs', function() {
                        $('#'+this.id+' .tab-pane').attr('tabindex',0);
                    });
                };

                activate();
            }
        }
    });
